data.title: Fix for issue #847, "SamplerStates aren't properly applied when active texture changes"
data.body:
What we would consider sampler state in D3D is stored per-texture in GL, so you have to have the correct active texture unit & texture bindings active before you call glTexParameter within SamplerState.Activate().

This change stores the "last SamplerState used" on the Texture instance, to avoid redundant glTexParameter calls.

It's possible this might make some redundant glActiveTexture parameters in cases where you use a single texture with frequently changing sampler states, maybe there is a better way to design this... it would be nice if it was somehow integrated with the related loop in TextureCollection.SetTextures().

data.title: Gamepad Control mappings not correct
data.body:
Hello,

I'm using the develop3d branch and i noticed the gamepad mappings are off.

i am using a logitech gamepad F710 that has functionality to emulate a xbox controller.

when not using that functionality the mappings are fine, but the left and right trigger buttons and joystick buttons do not function as well as the right joystick itself.

with the functionality on, the start and back buttons are mapped to the joystick buttons, the start button is mapped to the right trigger. the trigger buttons, back button, and the right joystick still do not function.

IEF..F..F...........E...F....F..FFFFFFE.........F..........F....
Unhandled Exception: System.AccessViolationException: Attempted to read or write protected memory. This is often an indication that other memory is corrupt.

   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTarget2D.Dispose() in d:\Projects\OpenSource\MonoGame\MonoGame.Framework\Graphics\RenderTarget2D.cs:line 179

Press any key to continue . . .

Note that few weeks ago, this did not occur, although the tests did not pass either.

data.title: Game window shifting randomly
data.body:
Having a strange problem that I cannot figure out.
Whenever I launch my game, its random whether it displays properly or not. (see pics)

Some things of note:  1. I use the gamestatemanagementsample as the base for my game, originally developed for winphone and xbox/pc.
1. I implemented the scaling code in screenmanager found in the tutorials section.  Is this needed? 
   http://infinitespace-studios.co.uk/2012/07/19/handling-multiple-screen-resolutions-in-monogame-for-android-part-1/
2. This is all in a 800x480 emulator, running 4.0.4, have not tested on real devices.
3.  Should i be doing something to detect the native resolution of the device?  

I'm trying to finish off this port. so any help is greatly appreciated.

![](http://s10.postimage.org/mid0njis9/cutoff.jpg)
![](http://s9.postimage.org/fwb2puu4v/normal.jpg)

data.title: Windows 8 games crash if IsFullscreen is set.
Remove the double attenuation on the volume of SFX in Android
data.body:
I'm not sure why the music stream volume was used to influence the SFX volume, but removing it fixes the issue where SoundEffects are played very quietly. At least on the devices I've tested, `audioManager.GetStreamVolume(Stream.Music);` returns the value you've set the device volume to using the hardware buttons. The end result was that sound effects had the device volume multiplied in again making them very quiet in comparison to the music, particularly when the device volume was low.

It's probably a good idea if some other people test this. Perhaps there was some reason the code was there, ie different behaviour in an old API or particular device. Note that change is in an Android only file.

data.title: Changes to the Installer for Beta release.
data.body: Also added the OcclusionQuery to the windows8 project. It needs fleshing out though as currently it always returns 0 for windows 8

data.title: Problems with Sound.cs, or am I just doing it wrong?
data.body:
So I just started looking into Monogame just the other day, and so far I like the sound of it. But, one major issue I ran into when building it though was a bunch of errors that showed up in the Windows Framework, under Windows/Audio/Sound.cs which seemed to be namespace issues between OpenTK.Audio and OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL.

It basically ended with me manually putting in either of the specific namespaces in front of all the variables causing the errors (so like, OpenTK.Audio."variable" or OpenTK.Audio.OpenAL."variable").

Having only been looking at this for like... two days in my spare time, I have no idea what either of these specific namespaces contribute to or how they work, I basically just did this until I had no errors. I feel like I might either be doing something wrong, got the wrong version of something, or stumbled upon an obvious error made during a recent build or something.

Any way I could upload a file here to get my version looked at, that is unless I did something flagrantly wrong.

data.title: Fixes #861, let's discuss
data.body:
The iOS authentication can take minutes with a bad connection and in the meantime, it was not possible to use the guide (which we use for starting a new game for example). I think that making the guide visible and blocking other guides is not needed.
Please test that this will not create any issues when the user needs to sign in by entering his credential.

data.title: Make iOS6 portrait applications work properly
data.body:
Allow dispose to unload the ContentManager (discussed in #859, but not fixing the actual issue)

The iOS6 issue was that the mask was only retrieved once, when the application started. That happened because the autorotation was always enabled. That retrieving happened happened before the Game constructor was called, therefore the mask way always "Default" (Landscape left + right). This resulted in potrait apps crashing (no common orientation).
By only enabing the autorotation when the game is initialized, we have the time to set up the supported orientations. When the autorotation gets enabled (after initialize) we will have the correct mask and the application will work as intended.

data.title: ALT+F4 quits instead of simply F4
data.body: See my comment at the bottom of issue #681

data.body:
Add PrimitiveBatch from DirectXTK.

data.title: Use VertexPositionColorTexture in SpriteBatcher (PSMobile)
data.body:
As discussed in the issue comments (issue #791), reverting this code to use the VertexPositionColorTexture.

PSMobile now happily compiles.

data.title: MGEffectProcessor is not being used by custom model processors...
data.body:
I have custom .fx files that I use for things like skinned animated models, instanced models, and even static models that use custom shader file references.  I get the following error when I try to use the MonoGame Effect Processor in the property settings and compile my model using my custom model processor.

Shaders\InstancedModel.fx : warning : Asset was built 2 times with different settings:
Shaders\InstancedModel.fx : warning : using EffectImporter and MGEffectProcessor
Shaders\InstancedModel.fx : warning : using EffectImporter and EffectProcessor, referenced by Models\Characters\test.fbx (InstancedModelProcessor)

data.title: SoundEffectInstance.State property getter returns a value in all #if conditionals
data.body:
In an attempt to fix the PSMobile project, this is a first fix.

The problem is that this property did not return a value in all different #if conditional branches (namely - in the last #elif, which PSMobile falls under since it is not Android or WinRT).

The fix is to simply return the private soundState field, as was before (i guess it was accidentally removed? )

data.title: TouchPanel Drag Fixes
data.body:
This mainly contains drag fixes which make the classification of vertical, horizontal, free drag, or none work like it does in WP7.

It also contains a couple of small improvements:
- Win8 launch parameter parsing supports =.
- Fixed namespace of ColorWriteChannels.
- Worked around SharpDX MediaEngine.PlaybackEvent bug.

data.title: MediaPlayer.PlaybackEvent not firing
ColorWriteChannels is in wrong namespace
data.body:
ColorWriteChannels is in the wrong namespace.  Not a huge deal but I did come across a compiler error in a file that did not include the base framework but did include .Graphics

XNA -  Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics
MonoGame - Microsoft.Xna.Framework

data.title: Added code to fall back on the default graphics mode under android
data.body:
On certain devices the default AndroidGameWindow GraphicsMode does not work even though the device says it supports it see issue #654.

This takes the advice from https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=6386 and adds a fallback incase the first call to base.CreateFrameBuffer fails.

data.title: iOS Orientation fixes
data.body:
After an orientation change we need to update TouchPanel DisplayHeight/Width or _touchScale will be incorrect.
This fixes Portrait games on iOS5.

@Nezz Since you touched this last could you please take a check, thanks :-)

You can install old simulators in xcode: XCode, Preferences, Downloads, Components, iOS 5.1 Simulator.

data.title: Compatibility Issue - Intel Graphics
data.body:
Hello I am currently having an issue running monogame on a particular laptop, I've verified OpenGL compatibility via OpenGL Extensions Viewer 3.0, and it fully supports OpenGL 2.1, I'm running on Windows 7 64 bit.

It affects the current revision, but MonoGame 2.5.1 does not seem to have an issue however.

Here is the trace.

```
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.EntryPointNotFoundException
Stack:
   at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL+Core.BindFramebuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.FramebufferTarget, UInt32)
   at OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.GL.BindFramebuffer(OpenTK.Graphics.OpenGL.FramebufferTarget, Int32)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.ApplyRenderTargets(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetBinding[])
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.Initialize()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager.Initialize()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager.CreateDevice()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GraphicsDeviceManager..ctor(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game)
   at Pokemon.Pokemon..ctor()
   at Pokemon.Program.Main(System.String[])
```

I don't seem to have any issue with other systems, the Graphics Card in question is a "Intel GMA 4500"

data.title: [iOS] GameCenter authentication blocks guide
data.body: When using GameCenter in an iOS game, its authentication can take a while. Until it's finished, it is not possible to use the guide.

data.title: Dispose SoundEffect and Texture2D (mainly RenderTarget2Ds) properly
data.body: ...from destructor to prevent memory leaks
